text: This mall and the street in front of this mall were very interesting to me. I’m not familiar with Chinese culture but I enjoyed the atmosphere of this place and around the temple near here. If you are into crystals and spiritual stuff, jade accessories, you’ll find this place interesting too. Clothing shops are cheaper than bugis street. Also there are traditional Chinese food ingredients shops. I’m glad I found traditional Chinese culture here in Singapore.
There are general stores selling everything from clothing to everyday necessities, suitable for locals.

If I'm going to Bugis Street, I always make time to go to Bencoolen. Not bad for traveling, especially if you want to buy a watch.
Along the road there are also many traders selling various things.
Decent collection of watch shops across different price points, but the mall itself smells perpetually like a toilet. Very unpleasant to shop here.
Interesting place where you can buy from watches, to traditional Chinese religious goods, get a foot massage , or meet a fortune teller. Very local , so that makes it worth visiting .
